entities.name: troy
entities.description: Troy is one of the people who lifted the Cup into the air along with Quigley, as described in the text: 'happily as Troy and Quigley lift ed the Cup into the air...'

entities.name: quigley
entities.description: Quigley is one of the people who lifted the Cup into the air along with Troy, as described in the text: 'happily as Troy and Quigley lift ed the Cup into the air...'

entities.name: aidan lynch
entities.description: Aidan Lynch is a member of the Irish team who performed a lap of honor on his broom, as described in the text: 'Aidan Lynch on the back of Connolly’s, clutching hard around his waist and still grinning in a bemused sort of way'

entities.name: connolly
entities.description: Connolly is a member of the Irish team who performed a lap of honor on his broom, as described in the text: 'Aidan Lynch on the back of Connolly’s, clutching hard around his waist and still grinning in a bemused sort of way'

entities.name: ludo bagman
entities.description: Ludo Bagman is a person who pointed his wand at his throat and muttered 'Quietus', as described in the text: 'Bagman pointed his wand at his throat and muttered, “Quietus.”'

entities.name: fred
entities.description: Fred is one of the Weasley twins who scambled over the backs of their seats to stand in front of Ludo Bagman, as described in the text: 'For Fred and George had just scrambled over the backs of their seats...'

entities.name: george
entities.description: George is one of the Weasley twins who scambled over the backs of their seats to stand in front of Ludo Bagman, as described in the text: 'For Fred and George had just scrambled over the backs of their seats...'

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person whose hands were numb with clapping, as described in the text: 'Harry’s hands were numb with clapping.'

relationships.description: Troy and Quigley lifted the Cup into the air together, as described in the text: 'happily as Troy and Quigley lift ed the Cup into the air...'

Aidan Lynch and Connolly performed a lap of honor together on their brooms, as described in the text: 'Aidan Lynch on the back of Connolly’s, clutching hard around his waist and still grinning in a bemused sort of way'
Fred and George scrambled over the backs of their seats together to stand in front of Ludo Bagman, as described in the text: 'For Fred and George had just scrambled over the backs of their seats...'
Ludo Bagman was stood in front of by Fred and George, as described in the text: 'For Fred and George had just scrambled over the backs of their seats...'
